policies.attendance: Attendance is mandatory for live sessions.
policies.late_work: Late work will be accepted with a deduction of 10% after one week.
policies.academic_integrity: All Stevens graduate students promise to be fully truthful and avoid dishonesty, fraud, misrepresentation, and deceit of any type in relation to their academic work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.course_format: The course is structured in a modular fashion, providing a foundation in data modeling, data warehousing, and data integration.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Zoom, Kaltura for videos, Software (ERwin, Alteryx, MongoDB, Tableau)
additional_info.support_resources: Office of Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS) offers free and confidential services.

_metadata.course_description: This course will focus on the design, management, and use of data warehouse (DW) and business intelligence (BI) systems.
learning_outcomes: Perform the functions of a data architect in industry as evidenced through lab assignments and the final project.
Assess business information needs and apply appropriate data-oriented technology solutions.
Apply the data warehouse life cycle in the development of a business intelligence system.
Leverage commercial tools (Erwin, MongoDB, and Alteryx) for business intelligence and data integration.
Build dashboards and visualizations for business intelligence.
prerequisites: Students must satisfy the requirements for enrollment in either the BI&A or MIS masterâ€™s degree programs.
